data.title: Fixed "ClassCastException"
data.body:
Hello!

Recently I faced to the problem with loading Android audio from custom external FileHandle's using AssetManager. It is custom, because I would like to load audio from external zip archive.

com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException: java.lang.ClassCastException: (custom class) cannot be cast to com.badlogic.gdx.backends.android.AndroidFileHandle

If user will create customized `FileHandleResolver`, so `resolve` method will return user `FileHandle`, the android application would crash at `AndroidAudio:144`.

To fix this the class cast should be called after checking if the file is internal.

data.title: Add another ScrollPane#scrollTo; fix #2561
data.body: This slightly changes the behavior of ScrollPane#scrollTo centering, and removes ScrollPane#scrollToCenter. ScrollPane#scrollToCenter was equivalent to ScrollPane#scrollTo(x, y, width, height, false, true);

data.title: Sound setPitch() doesn't work on iOS
data.body:
Hi, my gdx version is 1.4.1 and ios version 7.1

``` java
soundId = sound.loop(1,0.5f,1);
....
...
sound.setPitch(soundId,0.5f+incr,1); //Where incr is a variable that goes from 0 to 1.5f

```

This works on desktop version and every android device I tested, but not on iOS

data.title: proposed math util API enhancement
ScrollPane.scrollToCenter should center horizontally too
data.body: Since ScrollPane can scroll in both the x and y directions, it would make sense that [ScrollPane.scrollToCenter](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/scenes/scene2d/ui/ScrollPane.java#L788) (which "Sets the scroll offset so the specified rectangle is fully in view and centered vertically in the scroll pane, if possible.") would center the rectangle in both the horizontal and vertical directions, not just the vertical one. Or, perhaps, boolean parameters could be added: centerX and centerY (or centerHorizontal/centerVertical).

data.title: Sound panning doesn't work.
FrameBuffer can't use depth and stencil at the same time
data.body: I tried to direct create a FBO (didn't use FrameBuffer class) with standalone depth RBO and stencil RBO, but crashed with an opengl error: GL_FRAMEBUFFER_UNSUPPORTED. I tried to use FrameBuffer class but also got the error. It seems that FBO must use a combined buffer such as `GL_DEPTH24_STENCIL` when using both depth and stencil ([Reference](https://www.opengl.org/wiki/Framebuffer_Object_Examples#Stencil)). I had tried it in my laptop and it worked. However, I don't know will it work in Android and iOS...

data.title: Vector.Zero shoud give every time a new Object
data.body:
When starting a Vector with Vector.Zero and add to this Vector, the vector in Zero will edit and the next time of the call it will not be Vector2(0,0).

It is a problem in development, not have default Values every time.

Please change it. Thx

data.title: TextureUnpacker doesn't handles image indexs
data.body:
To handle animation, atlases packs images with the same name with an index. If the image index is -1, TextureUnpacker can work like now does but if it is != -1 it must save the image with the next name:

```
imagename_index.png
```

I solved this issue changing the line 66 like that:

```
File imgOutput = new File(outputDirFile, String.format("%s.%s", region.index == -1?region.name:region.name + "_" + region.index, extension));
```

https://github.com/macbury/ForgE/blob/master/editor/src/macbury/forge/editor/systems/SelectionSystem.java

data.title: drag&drop handlers of ScrollPane children don't work properly
data.body: There is a strange behavior when dealing with `ScrollPane` objects when it comes to drag&drop: if a child of the `ScrollPane` also has a `DragListener` registered, it doesn't work properly. After dragging, the `dragStop` method will be triggered, only by moving the mouse. Maybe the `ScrollPane` implementation doesn't allow children to register drag listeners. If it's intended by design, let me know.

data.title: Why AssetManager.disposeDependencies is private?
data.body:
Why AssetManager.disposeDependencies is private and is not used anywhere?
Is it inconvenient?

data.title: Fixed accuracy of the OpenAL music getPosition() and setPosition() on lwjgl backend
data.body:
This should hopefully fix #2545 and #2546.

I've reworked `setPosition()` to be more accurate and fixed a bug where it actually added the buffer's length to the elapsed time.

I've also found out that calculation for `secondsPerBuffer` was off for MP3 as the decoder apparently requires a 4096 bytes buffer overhead. This caused the reported time from `getPosition()` to become more and more off as the playback went on, and the issue also plagued `setPosition()` who relied on the same numbers for it's positioning. I've taken this overhead into account and the reported position is now spot on.

data.title: Music .mp3 files silent on iPhone 4 7.1
data.body:
Hello,

I've read through all previous posts about the sound problems on robovm and have not found any solutions to this problem. 

In Desktop, Android, and iOS Simulator, all sounds play perfectly. However, specifically on iPhone 4 on iOS 7.1 and 7.1.2 running robovm 0.0.13 or 0.0.14, and libgdx 1.4.1, all of my .mp3 files are completely silent. I've triple checked volume and other obvious sources, and tested on two separate devices. 

Cleared Gradle cache, refreshed all dependencies, and created a new project. No change.

Here is a link to one of the .mp3 files: https://www.dropbox.com/s/gzr9bmqrwhlyqre/good.mp3?dl=0

Here is the code (pretty basic):
s = Gdx.audio.newSound(Gdx.files.internal("good.mp3"));
s.play();

The same effect happens for Music class as well.

data.title: 'HttpResponseListener.failed' triggered from 'handleHttpResponse'
data.body:
Versions: 1.3.2, 1.4.2
In the desktop app, any exceptions thrown inside 'handleHttpResponse' get caught and passed to 'failed'. Not sure if this is the intended behavior or not, but it is arguably very unintuitive (one would expect 'failed' to be called only when the request itself fails, not when it succeeds but the response is mishandled). It also hinders debugging, as exceptions thrown by the response handling code remain silent and without a stack trace.

data.title: Quaterion.getAngleAround returns wrong angle in range 240°-360° for y-Axis
data.body:
Maybe there are problems with other Axises too.

Example:

Matrix4 m4 = new Matrix4();
        Quaternion q = new Quaternion();

```
    for (int degrees = 0; degrees < 360; degrees += 40) {
        System.out.println("degrees: " + degrees + " - getAngleAround: " + m4.idt().rotate(0, 1, 0, degrees).getRotation(q).getAngleAround(0, 1, 0));
    }
```

Output:

degrees: 0 - getAngleAround: 0.0
degrees: 40 - getAngleAround: 40.0
degrees: 80 - getAngleAround: 79.99999
degrees: 120 - getAngleAround: 120.0
degrees: 160 - getAngleAround: 159.99998
degrees: 200 - getAngleAround: 199.99998
degrees: 240 - getAngleAround: 120.0                           (_wrong)
degrees: 280 - getAngleAround: 79.99999                     (_wrong)
degrees: 320 - getAngleAround: 40.0                             (*wrong)

data.title: Music setPosition() on Desktop doesn't set the desired position
Music getPosition() on Desktop doesn't give accurate position.
data.body:
Using gdx version 1.4.2-SNAPSHOT

Loaded a Music instance and played it. On each frame, I added the delta value to a variable in order to get the real position. Some of the values obtained along the music being played, where pos :

``` java
getPosition(): 0.04063492 deltaPos: 0.03333036
getPosition(): 0.06095238 deltaPos: 0.05006868
getPosition(): 0.08126984 deltaPos: 0.06693603
getPosition(): 0.1015873 deltaPos: 0.083865695
getPosition(): 0.12190476 deltaPos: 0.10047909
.....
getPosition(): 10.019415 deltaPos: 8.997233
getPosition(): 10.019415 deltaPos: 9.0081835
getPosition(): 10.039732 deltaPos: 9.024423
......
getPosition(): 15.923091 deltaPos: 14.329101
getPosition(): 15.943409 deltaPos: 14.346734
getPosition(): 15.963726 deltaPos: 14.363102
....
getPosition(): 24.769863 deltaPos: 22.286882
getPosition(): 24.79018 deltaPos: 22.307085
getPosition(): 24.79018 deltaPos: 22.320536
getPosition(): 24.8105 deltaPos: 22.336187

```

The song had a duration of 22.622seg, so it was actually impossible to get a 24.8105 seg position

data.title: Improved limit()/clamp() behaviour - now it doesn't call nor(), reusing ...
data.body:
...the

(needed anyway) len var, resulting in _one_ scl() call instead of _two_.
Also, we use cached len, so that we don't have to calculate it twice.
Mostly beneficial for Vector3 class.

Mostly for

data.title: MoveToAction with alignment
data.body: MoveToAction with alignment. This would be nice to have. The changes I made don't break the current API, just add to it.

data.title: platform-independent logging interface
data.body: I assume we could have either a static interface for logging (currently all debug()/log()/error() are linked with app instance) and/or a dedicated platform-independent app-independent logger class, allowing easy platform-independent access even before app init. For example, https://gist.github.com/vaxquis/8a0078f97546352cec21

data.title: new UV scaling/translation support throwing NullPointerException
data.body:
https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/graphics/g3d/Model.java#L276

is the culprit; it is not null-guarded, so any ModelTexture with those not set (e.g. created by ObjLoader) will crash the app.

Solution 1 (preferred): add null-guards.
Solution 2: add new Vector2() when initializing ModelTexture, https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/graphics/g3d/model/data/ModelTexture.java

As to ObjLoader, I've got a new version almost ready for merge request, so in theory it could set those two to identify vectors (0,0 & 1,1) - still, creating a ModelMaterial with ModelTexture manually causes the same error, by not highlighting the fact that 

```
public Vector2 uvTranslation;
public Vector2 uvScaling;
```

can't be null for the related code to run.
